title: issue with ubuntu GPU cuda installation
body:
Hello, I am really new to Deeplabcut. 

I have been troubled with installing Deeplabcut.

OS: Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS
GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 SUPER 8GB
Anaconda3-2019.07, using the official vertual env (DLC-GPU.yaml; thus Deeplabcut 2.0)

First I followed the official installation guide (https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/installation.md) and I tried to install NVIDIA 384.111 driver. But it yielded an installation error.

```
ERROR: An error occurred while performing the step: "Building kernel modules". See /var/log/nvidia-installer.log for details.

ERROR: An error occurred while performing the step: "Checking to see whether the nvidia kernel module was successfully built".
See /var/log/nvidia-installer.log for details.

ERROR: The nvidia kernel module was not created.

ERROR: Installation has failed. Please see the file '/var/log/nvidia-installer.log' for details. You may find suggestions on
fixing installation problems in the README available on the Linux driver download page at www.nvidia.com.
```

According to NVIDIA developer website, the driver 384.xx is outdated.
https://forums.developer.nvidia.com/t/i-cant-install-nvidia-driver-an-error-occurred-while-performing-the-step-building-kernel-modules/72239
I also tried 410.93 driver referring to this web site, but I got the same error.
https://optogeneticsandneuralengineeringcore.gitlab.io/ONECoreSite/projects/DeepLabCut/

I have tried the newer 450.80.02 driver, but CUDA 11.0 was automatically installed and yielded an error when I ran deeplabcut.train_network(). The error message was like that:
`Failed to get convolution algorithm. This is probably because cuDNN failed to initialize, so try looking to see if a warning log message was printed above.`

What version of driver should I use? Thank you in advance.
